movesets.name: Lead

items.name: Damp Rock
items.description: Rain Dance and Drizzle lasts 8 turns.

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

Rain Dance ensures weather due to Voltorb's extremely high Speed. It also makes Thunder, Voltorb's best attack, 100% accurate. Thunder is deadly under rain. However, it's too unreliable to be used without rain, so be sure to have Rain Dance up before you use the move. Volt Switch is an effective switching move, especially when coupled with STAB. It is useful in many situations and can to ensure Voltorb's survival in tight spots. Taunt is a good choice to counter the opponent's lead and status Pokemon, and can also stop boosting sweepers in their tracks. It is especially useful against entry hazard users such as Dwebble, as well as being Voltorb's only real niche over Elekid. However, it's next to useless against anything else and Thunder Wave can be used instead.

Set Details

Static is a useful ability in any situation, and offers a decent paralysis chance and that can cripple enemies. Aftermath can be equally useful by damaging defensive checks to Voltorb that manage to knock it out. Item-wise, a Damp Rock is almost mandatory for anything running Rain Dance. Eviolite should be used to bolster Voltorb's pitiful defenses in lieu of rain. The latter item prevents many OHKOs, notably from Choice Scarf users such as Pawniard and Mienfoo. The given EV spread allows Voltorb to deal significant damage, and, with a Timid nature, to outspeed almost the entire metagame.

Usage Tips

This set is useful as a support lead and can deal serious damage to boot. Use the Rain Dance variant on rain teams as a Rain Dance user and a rain sweeper. The Eviolite variant is an excellent status lead on any team. Voltorb's tremendous Speed allows it to revenge kill quite a few Pokemon, as well as to outspeed and KO some other common leads.

Team Options

This set can't run Hidden Power Ice, so an Ice- or Grass-type is welcome to deal with Ground-types. Grass also resists Electric, so a Fire- or Flying-type helps as well. Even a Bug-type might be helpful, and might also be used to counter the many Psychic-type special walls that check this set. Of course, anything with an ability boosted by rain also benefits from this set.

movesets.name: Offensive

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Taunt is one of Voltorb's niches and is always an extremely useful move in LC. It's also the only thing offensive Voltorb has on Elekid. Of course, Taunt is difficult almost pointless to use with a Choice item, so Charge Beam must be used if you use the Choice Specs to provide an attacking boosting move. However, Taunt absolutely must be used on non-Choice item sets.Thunderbolt is Voltorb's only reliable high Base Power STAB special attack, and is itsVoltorb's main means of sweeping. It will deal a sizable chunk of damage to many Pokemon with a Life Orb, and even more with Choice Specs. Hidden Power Ice is Voltorb's source of coverage on the two types that resist Electric: Ground and Grass. It's moderately powerful with the boosting items that can be used with this set.

Set Details

Again, Static is a powerful ability which can provide Voltorb with the capability to spread paralysis even with only offensive moves. Aftermath can be quite nice as well, making a revenge kill by a teammate much more likely.The Life Orb is a useful item which definitely increases Voltorb's damage output, yet the Choice Specs provides a much bigger boost at the cost of versatility. Generally, the Life Orb is preferable, but make the choice based on your own discretion. The same EV spread as used on the first set is advised here, and is equally useful because it allows Voltorb to outspeed and OHKO or 2HKO most of the metagame. Timid allows Voltorb to hit 20 Speed and outrun almost every other unboosted Pokemon.

Usage Tips

Voltorb is an effective attacker and one of very few decent Electric-types in LC. It can be used as a special attacker on any team needing some Electric coverage. The Choice Specs variant of this set can be used as a powerfulpivot, and with the right switching, can be well-assisted by a different Life Orb user such as Abra. Feel free to attach a Choice Scarf to this set as well, as it allows this set to outspeed the entirety of LC, even when facing other Choice Scarf users others are Scarfed.

Team Options

Some defensive allies are helpful to this set, like such as Tirtouga and Koffing. Voltorb's pitiful defenses need some backup. Attackers to counter Rock- and Steel-types are also welcome, because this set can't handle those very well. For the Choice Specs set, something with U-turn to build a VoltTurn core is useful. As mentioned previously, Abra is also very useful.

moves.name: Charge
moves.description: Doubles power of an Electric-type move used next turn.

moves.name: Charge Beam
moves.description: 70% chance to boost Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Eerie Impulse
moves.description: Harshly lowers the target's Special Attack stat.

moves.name: Electro Ball
moves.description: Inflicts more damage the faster the user is compared to the target.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Explosion
moves.description: Faints the user.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Gyro Ball
moves.description: Does damage based on the foe's Speed and the user's Speed.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Rock
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Steel
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Water
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Magic Coat
moves.description: Bounces back certain non-damaging moves.

moves.name: Magnet Rise
moves.description: User becomes immune to Ground moves for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mirror Coat
moves.description: If hit by a special attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Refresh
moves.description: Removes status.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.description: Doubles in power with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Screech
moves.description: Lowers foe's Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Self-Destruct
moves.description: Faints the user.

moves.name: Shock Wave
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Sonic Boom
moves.description: Does 20 damage. Ghosts are immune.

moves.name: Spark
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.description: The user always moves first. Will only work if the foe attacked.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Volt Switch
moves.description: Forces user to switch.

moves.name: Wild Charge
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

abilities.name: Aftermath
abilities.description: Deals 25% damage when KOed by contact damage.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: Enemies' contact moves can paralyze them.
